title: Exports 'aren't going to save us' if housing and investment in Canada is weak: Manulife's Donald
description: Frances Donald, chief economist at Manulife Investment Management talks about the divergence we are going to start seeing between the Canadian and U.S. economies as the effects of the pandemic unfold.

title: Toronto home sales sink 67% in April
description: Canada's largest housing market went into a deep freeze last month as COVID-19 pushed buyers and sellers to the sidelines. BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell has the details.

title: Benjamin Tal: Forced housing transactions in illiquid times will distort data
description: Benjamin Tal joins to discuss the impact that the economic freeze is having on the real estate market - including why price data will be influenced by limited liquidity in forced transactions; including those investors in the short-term rental market.

title: Toronto housing enters deep freeze as sales sink 69%
description: Toronto's housing market went into a deep freeze in the first half of April as COVID-19 decimated homebuyer demand, with home sales falling 69 per cent year-over-year during the first 17 days of the month. BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell reports.

title: It doesn't take much extra supply to tip the housing market: Veritas
description: Anthony Scilipoti, president and CEO of Veritas Investment Research discusses the pandemic's negative effects on the housing market.

title: Once safer than gold, Canadian real estate braces for reckoning
description: Canadian housing once seemed so infallible that the head of the world's biggest asset manager in 2015 described Vancouver condos as a better store of wealth than gold. The coronavirus is putting that theory to the test. Bloomberg News' Natalie Obiko Pearson reports.

title: COVID-19 threatens Canadian housing
description: BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell discusses a Bloomberg News report looking at how Canadian real estate - a pillar of the country's economy - could be at risk due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Housing transactions way down from what's normal this time of year: Royal LePage
description: Royal Lepage CEO Phil Soper says that March saw a significant decline in housing transactions in large part because people aren't working, but adds that there is still hope for the housing market in the summer season if the economy can be eased back to pre-pandemic levels in the coming months.

title: Little impact on April rents, but 'a lot of nervousness' around aid for May rent: CAPREIT CEO
description: Mark Kenney, president and CEO of CAPREIT talks about the rental apartment market and how it's being affected by the pandemic. He says the "overwhelming majority of apartment stock" is owned by individuals and tenants need to know they have support from landlords, as well as government.

title: The economy will get 'ugly', but recession won't last more than 2-3 quarters: Fmr. BNY Mellon CEO
description: Robert P. Kelly, former CEO at BNY Mellon and former CMHC chair joins BNN Bloomberg to weigh in on the high number of mortgage deferral requests, the strength of Canada's banks and how deep the recession could be amid the COVID-19 pandemic. He says that Canada's banks are strong but that the economic recession could get "pretty ugly" for a few quarters.

title: Creative solutions required to get ahead of a rent crisis: Ontario Rental Housing Federation CEO
description: Tony Irwin, president and CEO of the Ontario Federation of Rental Housing Providers says there are going to be some tough conversations that need to happen between landlords and tenants, that deferrals are the only way to get around payment defaults.

title: We need to provide immediate financial stability for renters: Head of tenants association
description: Geordie Dent, executive director of the Federation of Metro Tenants Association says government needs to provide more support for renters to reduce the risk of eviction and exacerbating the COVID-19 problem.

title: 'If you need help, you will get help': CMHC's promise to homeowners with mortgages
description: BNN Bloomberg speaks with Evan Siddall, president and CEO of Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation.

title: Stephen Poloz: Once-hot housing markets 'back to normal'
description: Bank of Canada Governor Stephen Poloz talks about the central bank's move to slash the benchmark interest rate to mitigate coronavirus risk and what it means for Canada's already-record-high household debt.

title: Former CMHC chair explains why he's 'a bit of a bear' on housing
description: Robert P. Kelly, former CEO at BNY Mellon and former CMHC chair, joins BNN Bloomberg to react to the rate cuts from both the Bank of Canada and Federal Reserve amid coronavirus fears. He also provides perspective on the BoC's rate cut and implications for the housing market.

title: Why you may not want to rush into buying a new home after the BoC rate cut
description: The Bank of Canada’s rate cut could have more Canadians applying for a cheaper mortgage, but could this lead to more risks than benefits for the housing market? Justin Thouin, CEO and co-founder of LowestRates.ca tells us more.

title: Toronto home prices roar back in February
description: Home prices in Toronto surged in February, with sales jumping from a 10-year low. The average sale for a detached home in central Toronto clocked in at nearly $1.2 million, up about eight per cent from the previous year. BNN Bloomberg’s Jon Erlichman has more.

title: Five-year mortgage rates could fall 10 basis point in two to three weeks: Rates.ca
description: Global bond yields are plunging to historic lows, raising the prospects for lower mortgage rates for house-hungry Canadians. For perspective on this and why he thinks five-year rates could fall another 10 basis points in a number of weeks, BNN Bloomberg spoke with Rob McLister, mortgage editor at Rates.ca.

title: Coronavirus might boost sales in home improvement sector: Analyst
description: Ken Leon, director of equity research at CFRA Research, talks about the latest earnings from Home Depot and why he thinks the coronavirus could drive up profits in the home improvement sector.

title: U.S. housing boosts Home Depot
description: Bloomberg Intelligence’s Drew Reading has a breakdown of Home Depot’s latest earnings.

title: New stress test rules 'inconsequential' in current market conditions: Mortgage provider
description: The federal government is changing the stress test rules for insured mortgages, potentially lowering the bar to entry for house-hungry Canadians. For perspective on this and why he thinks it's inconsequential in current market conditions, BNN Bloomberg spoke with Albert Collu, president at M3 Mortgage Operations.

title: China’s Property Sector Faces Cash Crunch
description: Feb.23 -- China’s debt-laden property developers are facing a cash crunch as the coronavirus outbreak brings the real estate market to its knees. The ramification are potentially huge for the overall economy, with the property sector directly accounting for about 7% of China’s GDP. Bloomberg’s Katrina Nicholas reports on “Bloomberg Markets: Asia.”

title: Amanda Lang: What the stress test changes mean for the housing sector
description: BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang gives her take on the new changes to the mortgage stress tests.

title: RioCan CEO: Our bet on rental housing is paying off
description: RioCan REIT CEO Ed Sonshine discusses the company’s latest quarter and their play in purpose-built developments.

title: How real estate could take a hit from the coronavirus beyond hotels and resorts
description: Jeffrey Olin, president and CEO of Vision Capital, talks about a big transaction in the REIT space and the key trends affecting real estate, including the coronavirus,

title: Lowering mortgage stress test barriers could add fuel to the fire: Vancouver realtor
description: The federal government is adjusting the stress tests applied to insured mortgages, raising concerns the new tests could drive demand higher. For more on this and why he thinks this may well add fuel to the fire when it comes to price appreciation, BNN Bloomberg spoke with Steve Saretsky, Vancouver realtor and author of SteveSaretsky.com.

title: Mortgage rate easing doesn't go far enough: Industry association
description: Paul Taylor, president and CEO of Mortgage Professionals Canada, gives his take on the mortgage stress test changes and their potential impact on the housing market.

title: Gas prices fuel 2.4% inflation in January
description: Higher gasoline prices helped drive up the consumer price inflation index in its latest reading. However, core inflation, seen as a better gauge of underlying price pressures on Canadian consumers, has decelerated. Shelly Hagan of Bloomberg News reports from Ottawa.

title: How 'stress test' changes might impact Canadian home prices
description: Andrew Husby, economist at Bloomberg Economics, explains how the federal government’s easing of the "stress test" rules for insured mortgages may contribute to rising home prices.

title: If home prices continue to rise, increased speculative activity could return: TD economist
description: TD economist Rishi Sondhi joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss his latest report on the 2020 housing outlook.

title: Desjardins CEO: We want to play an active role in sustainable finance
description: Guy Cormier, president and CEO of Desjardins Group, offers his view on the role sustainable finance can play in creating Canada’s low carbon future. He also provides an update on the business since it was hit with a data breach.

title: Canadian housing starts hit four-month high
description: Canadian builders are putting shovels in the ground as housing starts hit a four-month high in January, which could provide some relief to the country’s increasingly tight real estate market. Bloomberg News’ Theo Argitis reports from Ottawa.

title: Creating a plan for your first mortgage
description: Rob McLister, mortgage editor at Rates.ca, joins BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell to walk through the steps that you should be considering when getting your first mortgage for a house.

title: Latest Toronto housing data raises 'some concerns': Realosophy's John Pasalis
description: Canada’s largest housing market continued to be plagued by shrinking inventory in the first month of 2020 — and that spurred another double-digit jump in prices. John Pasalis, president at Realosophy Realty, joins BNN Bloomberg to react to Toronto's latest housing data.

title: 'Action-packed' spring ahead for housing if banks match TD's mortgage rate cut: Rob McLister
description: TD has cut its posted five-year mortgage rate from 5.34 per cent to 4.99 per cent. To explain what this means for the Canadian housing market, BNN Bloomberg spoke to Rob McLister, mortgage editor at Rates.ca.

title: Cenovus pledges $50M to build Indigenous housing
description: Cenovus CEO Alex Pourbaix joins BNN Bloomberg's Tara Weber to discuss the company's initiative to spend $10 million annually on housing for First Nations communities for the next five years.

title: Ontario Premier Ford hits back against criticisms from pot executives
description: BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell speaks with Ontario Premier Doug Ford about the key economic issues for the province. They discuss trade, cannabis, and the real estate market.

title: Canada's housing shortage 'needs a national strategy': ReMax executive
description: Christopher Alexander, executive VP and regional director at REMAX, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss what a future Bank of Canada rate cut could mean for Canada's housing market.

title: 'Snow washing,' SNC fallout push Canada out of 10 least corrupt countries rankings
description: BNN Bloomberg speaks with James Cohen, executive director at Transparency International Canada, about the country's global standing in their Transparency International Corruption Perception Index over the past year.

title: Bank of Canada decision strengthens case for fixed-rate mortgages: LowestRates.ca
description: Justin Thouin, CEO and co-founder of LowestRates.ca, discusses the latest Bank of Canada decision and what it means for mortgage holders.

title: Household debt, housing in focus ahead of Bank of Canada decision
description: The Bank of Canada is expected to announce Wednesday it will keep interest rates unchanged despite a reacceleration in the housing market, particularly in Toronto, and rising household debt levels. Greg Bonnell has more.

title: Many Canadians would give up in-person mortgage advice for a lower rate: Survey
description: A new survey from Rates.ca says many Canadians would forego in-person mortgage advice in return for a lower interest rate. For more on this, BNN Bloomberg spoke with Rob McLister, mortgage editor at Rates.ca.

title: Pharrell teams up with developer to design 'Untitled' Toronto condo towers
description: Musician Pharrell Williams and Reserve Properties' Shane Fenton join BNN Bloomberg's Jon Erlichman to discuss the design of a new condominium development that's being planned for Toronto's midtown.

title: U.S. Housing Starts Leap to a 13-Year High in December
description: Jan.17 -- Julia Coronado, founder and president at Macropolicy Perspectives, examines U.S. housing starts that showed a 16.9% gain in December, the highest in 13 years. She speaks with Bloomberg’s Alix Steel on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: China’s Property Market Outlook Is Stable: Moody’s Investors Service
description: Jan.15 -- Franco Leung, associate managing director at Moody’s Investors Service, discusses his outlook for China’s housing market for 2020. He speaks on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: Montreal luxury home sales soar in 2019
description: Montreal's housing market is heating up, including its luxury real estate. We take a look at the major gains in sales activity with Don Kottick, CEO of Sotheby's International Realty Canada. He also talks about where international demand for Canadian housing is coming from.

title: Amanda Lang: Much talk and little action as lack of housing supply remains a problem
description: BNN Bloomberg's Amanda Lang gives her take on the lack of affordable housing in Canada and what can be done to alleviate the problem.

title: Lack of supply in Toronto weighs on Canadian home sales
description: Dwindling housing supply in Toronto dragged Canadian home sales lower in December, with existing home sales falling 0.9 per cent compared to the previous month. Theo Argitis reports from Ottawa.

title: Toronto housing prices rise more than what most people in the city make in a year
description: Penelope Graham, managing editor at Zoocasa, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss a new report that shows the Toronto median house price jumped nearly the equivalent of a year’s salary for an average Torontonian. She talks about what needs to change to help Canadians handle the hot housing market.

title: 'Only supply versus demographic demand counts': Altus Group economist on population and housing
description: Following the second-best decade on record after the 1970s for Canada's housing, Peter Norman, vice-president and chief economist at Altus Group, discusses the firm's latest survey on the health of the sector.
